About PW EMS Monitoring and Reporting

Parallel Wireless Element Management System (PW EMS) Monitoring and Reporting application is provided through a Web User Interface (UI). This application collects device data from the system and presents it in interactive charts, graphs, Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), and alerts so operators can respond to the way devices are performing on the network.

PW EMS Monitoring and Reporting uses the open-source software application Grafana as a platform to obtain data, which analyzes, measures, and reports network performance using data collected periodically from network components managed by the PW EMS. Different use cases collect and process all wireless network element configuration, fault, alarm, event, performance, and security management functions.

The PW EMS uses its SON functionality to monitor, measure, and optimize operations of the radio access network (RAN) and core mobile network, which includes the network configuration, events, logs, alarms, counters, KPIs and so on. This data is collected from devices such as the HetNet Gateway (HNG) device and access network devices such as Virtual Baseband Unit (vBBU), Remote Radio Head (RRH), and Converged Wireless System (CWS) devices.

  • PW EMS Network Monitoring Architecture
    The data collection, storage and processing platform serves as the data source for elements that includes the network configuration, events, logs, alarms, counters, and KPIs.
  • PW EMS Monitoring and Reporting Components
  • PW EMS Monitoring and Reporting Installation
    The PW EMS control (Web UI) and data (Monitoring and Reporting) functions each have different software dependencies and run on different Virtual Machines (VMs). Refer to the Software Installation and Upgrade Guide for more information.
  • Organization Roles
    The organization membership of a user is tied to a role that defines what the user is allowed to do in that organization. Users can belong to one or more organizations and the following roles and permissions can be configured for them. Refer to the appropriate Grafana documentation for more information about their configuration.
  • Counter Management
    The PW EMS Monitoring and Reporting function manages counters it receives in a large form file from the vBBU through the Secure File Transfer Protocol (SFTP) micro-service.
  • Access PW EMS Monitoring and Reporting
    Use this task to access the PW EMS Monitoring and Reporting application.
  • Access Default Dashboards
    Access various pre-existing PW EMS Monitoring and Reporting dashboards that display system component status information, access network Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), and system performance information.
  • Create a New Dashboard
    Use this task to create a new dashboard in PW EMS Monitoring and Reporting.
  • Export a Dashboard
    Use this task to export a dashboard from PW EMS Monitoring and Reporting.
  • Import a Dashboard
    Use this task to import a dashboard into PW EMS Monitoring and Reporting.
  • Download Data from a Panel
    Use this task to download data in the form of a CSV file from a PW EMS Monitoring and Reporting Panel.
